comment: I literally changed my major to History Education because of Prof. O'Brien. His lectures were really interesting, and his quizzes and tests were not hard at all if you paid attention. Only one paper, and it wasn't too bad; again, just pay attention in class and you're good to go. Takes attendance once a week, however it is random, so try to show up

My favorite professor at KSU! Really gets you excited about history and digs into the nuances of events. Come to class and you shouldn't have a problem passing. Also, he's just a really great guy who cares about his students. Definitely take him. You won't regret it.

OBrien is a tough professor, but he is clear with his expectations. Theres quizzes, learning curves, discussions, and tests. He also provides video lectures for online courses. He goes back to see if you actually watched them so be mindful because he can grade harshly. Hes easy to work with if you show that your putting in effort.

Do yourself a favor and take this man's class. I've never enjoyed a history class more before in my life. He even set up a game that we played as a class which was in place of the research paper and the winners got to skip the final. He really is wanting to help teach his students and is always available to chat. Great guy 10/10.

This was one of the better online classes I've taken because you are rewarded for doing good work. If you want an online classes where you don't really have to do anything and can still score an A, don't take his  class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor wants you to do well, at the same time is a super tough grader on assignments that should be easy A. can also be super condescending, has class surveys but then gets upset at the critiques, no matter what its your fault for not putting in enough effort. Overall though the work is easy, I got a B without reading the book.

Mr. Pat was the best professor I have ever had. He's caring, funny, and really wants to see you succeed. He provides tons of resources, that help you understand material. He made the class very fun by incorporating a game we played for 6 weeks. He really knows his stuff and after taking this class you will have learned lots about American History.

Tough but fair. There is a lot due for an online class. He actually grades discussion boards. But he also gives study guides that pretty much tell you the quiz questions. If you watch the lectures and skim the readings, you'll do fine. Also, unless you want to get 100 emails from him, don't miss due dates.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: My guy Pat! I hate history but i actually enjoyed this class so much! his powerpoints are detailed and gives study guides for every quiz (which are open notes!!). I wouldnt suggest slacking off bc not only will he email you to meet and get your grades up, but his tests arent the ones to not be prepared for! hes very understanding and cool! 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: An extremely passionate professor who certainly knows how to guide his students to challenge themselves in not just the quizzes, but also allows us space for improvement through the use of very useful feedback. You have to take this class seriously and don't slack on the reading/weekly assignments. Allows open notes and study guides for preparation
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Pretty good professor that cares about his students; he gives good feedback on the quizzes and paper. This is not a super easy class that you can just skip, not try, and expect an easy A. You do have to work for it. However, it is not dreadful work. There are open note quizzes and learning curves weekly. Hardest assignment is 3-5 page paper.

Mr. O'Brien was easily my favorite professor so far. He's engaging, takes the content seriously and really understands it. The workload is balanced with some easy weekly assignments, a few moderately challenging quizzes and the tough primary source paper, but you're given a lot of freedom with the paper, so it's tough but very fair.

Pat is an amazing professor. He genuinely cares about his students doing well and always goes out of his way to help. His lectures are fun and easy to understand, and even though there can be a lot of work sometimes, he gives great feedback and if you take notes, you should do fine. Quizzes are all open notes. Definitely recommend!!
Professor Pat is super cool and does have things due almost every week, but it is very simple and easy as long as you do your work on time and show up more often then not you will be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very personable and takes his job seriously. It's a bit of a tough course but he really wants you to leave the class with a better understanding of how to think like a historian.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: He is definitely the best history teacher. You have quizzes and hw due almost every Friday. They are really simple if you just do the study guides and show up to class. There is one paper due throughout the semester. He takes attendance once a week. Gives extra credit so take advantage of it. He really makes history super easy. TAKE HIM!!

He is tough. He also really cares about the material and students. Most professors just teach and grade. But he actually wants to make sure you get it and do well. He gives study guides and extra credit and open-notes quizzes. You'll have to work and actually want to learn. But if you do, you can do well.

Great guy, makes everything clear about the material and how to access it. As long as you actually pay attention to the lectures, take notes, and study, it should be an easy A. Be willing to put in some work, it will pay off.

I really liked this professor. Based on some reviews I was not looking forward to him, but he really makes it worth it. He is super passionate, loves to talk to you and to help whenever he can, and goes by his rubrics so you know what to do and what to expect. He's really one of the best ones I've had. It might seem bad, but it was not bad at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He made history interesting. He is passionate about what he teaches and in that he can be a tough grader. I took him online. Quizzes, discussion post, and learning curves were due by 6pm Friday. The final and midterm were multiple choice and short answer responses. We also had a primary source paper. This is not an easy A but worth it.

only take if history is your favorite thing ever. he expects you to be a history major. he requires a lot out of his students. you have something due every friday, a quiz or discussion post. quizzes are made by him. he grades discussion posts fr, he doesnt just give you a participation grade. our final study guide was 9 pages.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Amazing. Phenomenal lectures and very kind. He gives great feedback from assignments and is very reachable. The course work was really not that overwhelming. You do need to participate in class. The tests were easy, there was one large essay but he helps you through it. Best teacher and an awesome rep for KSU. The assignments are easy- just do it!

In his online class, we had about 1-3 lecture videos a week. There was a discussion post due and then a reply and learningcurve due the next day. Its a lot of work, but ive never had a professor who cares about his work & students as much as he does! ive also never actually learned as much about history as i have this semester

He's a great professor. His lectures are great study material for quizzes and tests, but you will need to read the online book. If you miss a week or two he won't penalize you, but after that he'll start putting in zeros. There's a weekly discussion board, and you'll have to respond to a classmate's discussion. Take good notes and you'll be fine.

If you are a history enthusiast or like to learn, I would highly recommend this class. There is a hefty amount of textbook work, lectures, and a quiz almost every week but Professor Pat is clearly excited about what he teaches and is very engaging. He's extremely responsive with emails and gives great feedback on discussion boards and essays.

The people complaining about this guy just don't want to do the work and would complain about any good class. If you do the readings/participate in class, he's there to help with whatever you need. AND YOU ACTUALLY LEARN! Take if you need this required course, but want a professor who actually cares about the material and helping you succeed.

Professor Pat is very passionate about history, and you can tell right from day 1. He teaches the material well and gives plenty of extra sources. The workload was noticeably more than my other classes, but it was manageable. Passing the class is not hard, however getting an A is. He does not give them away, and you need a 93 for an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Pat is probably the best professor I have had. It sucks to see how many people are hating on him. His class is definitely not easy but he gives you all the tools needed to be successful. He is super passionate about history and explains everything so well. I've taken many college courses and this is by far one of the best. TAKE HIM!!!

it breaks my heart to see so many people hating on this guy. Yes, his class is much harder then it needs to be. But the professor makes up for it in the amount of effort he puts into the class. He genuinely cared about the content and his students and is more then happy to help if youre struggling. He responds to emails within minutes. Good guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: I would give a 0 to this teacher. I have never been more annoyed by a teacher. He gives a lot of assignments and tests. I took history 2112, and the material was made for someone who is majoring in history. I took the class because it was a requirement, not because I want to know more history. Please do not take his classes. Look for another teache
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This has been the most difficult history class I have ever taken. You cannot google any answers, quizzes are lockdown webcam on, the questions on the quiz do not line up with things being taught. Not enough time for the amount of questions given. Critical on discussion boards, will compare you to high schoolers. Beware of this class. Not a easy A

He is a good professor and he really cares!! but he gives a good bit of work. He gives a discussion every week that requires evidence from either the primary sources or text book and it has to be 2 paragraphs long to get a good grade. Theres a primary source that fairly simple. As long as you pay attention you do the work you will pass though!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor O'Brien is a very nice guy, and he cares about history a lot, and is for sure a certified historian. His tests can be difficult, because they are very heavily informational and you can not just cheat to get through. Every week he makes a video, with slides, which are very informational just make sure you watch them. Discussions weekly.

There is a LOT of work in this class with lots of reading, but he grades pretty fair and is understanding if you need an extension. He grades in a reasonable amount of time and you will know what your grade actually is for the most part. The one thing I really hate about his class is the grading scale. You have to get a 92 to get an A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Professor O'Brien is a very nice and friendly teacher. He really cares about history and treats everyone taking his course with respect. However, the information given for you to study and adequately prepare for exams is not enough. In order to do well on the exam and quiz, you will have to study for 20 hours. this class is about memorization.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: He really cares about history. This class requires lots of reading and note taking, but he is organized and does help sessions and gives extra credit. He is a super nice guy, and is a good professor! I would recommend taking hist. w/ him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hardest core class I've taken. If you love history and want two core classes of work for the price of one, then this class is for you! His Syllabus: 10% textbook reading and answering questions, 15% for 9 multi-paragraph discussion posts, 15% for 5 "quizzes" actually 40 questions w/ 1-2 short answer, 15% for 3-5 page paper, 20% midterm, 25% final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He loves history. He has a lot of work in his class, especially the readings. But if you do them, everything else is easy. He also does a lot to make sure everything make sense. You get the grade you work for in this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Ill start by saying this: He seems to genuinely enjoy history. This is a gen ed class for me and while I dont expect gen eds to be easy breezy this class is my hardest and Im taking 4 major classes. We have discussions learning curves, lecture videos, and as textbook pages to read. He grades hard and his feedback can feel a bit condescending.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are doing something in ur life that requires history that badly, take this class. other than that there is no reason to take his class. didn't really teach just gave us chapters of books and discussions were so irrelevant to what we should be learning. overall it was just way harder than a history class needs to be
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read
